title.value: Use of near infrared spectroscopy in breeding evaluation of malting properties of spring barley grain
Использование ближней инфракрасной спектроскопии в селекционной оценке пивоваренных свойств зерна ярового ячменя

journal.title: Arable Farming and Breeding in Belarus : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Bezlyudnyj, V.N., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Scientific and Practical Center for  Arable Farming

abstract.value: In course of the research there was studied the predictive models of spring barley (Hordeum vulgare) malting properties (malt extract, malt friability, viscosity of congress mashes) by spectra of grain samples using artificial neural networks. The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus. As a material for research were used 159 samples of spring barley, which were grown in laboratories of the Research and Practical Centre of National Academy of Science of Belarus for Arable Farming in 2009-2011. According to the characteristics of the received predictive models and testing results, it was concluded that there was a possibility to use the near infrared spectroscopy for preliminary estimation of grain quality in malting barley breeding. Comparison of results of definition of extractivity and friability of malt by a method of near infra-red spectroscopy of barley grain, comparison of results of definition of a mash viscosity by a method of near infra-red spectroscopy of barley grain and characteristics of malting properties of samples of barley grain were presented.
